block.p: Alexis Fox Hilton, a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Hilton of New York, was married last evening to Philip Adam Mintz, the son of Rayna Ragonetti of New York. Rabbi Geoff Hurst officiated at the Ocean Club on Paradise Island in the Bahamas.

Mrs. Mintz, 27, is a director of marketing for Miramax Films in New York. She graduated from Colgate. Her father is a senior vice president at CB Richard Ellis Real Estate in New York and is on the board of the Madison Square Boys and Girls Club of New York. Her mother, Marjorie Hilton, owns an interior design firm bearing her name in New York.

Mrs. Mintz, 27, is a director of marketing for Miramax Films in New York. She graduated from Colgate. Her father is a senior vice president at CB Richard Ellis Real Estate in New York and is on the board of the Madison Square Boys and Girls Club of New York. Her mother, Marjorie Hilton, owns an interior design firm bearing her name in New York.

Mr. Mintz, 34, is a vice president for mergers and acquisitions at Merrill Lynch & Company, the New York investment bank. He graduated from Duke, received a law degree from Fordham and an M.B.A. from New York University. His mother, who is retired, owned Ruth's Dresses, a former clothing store in New York.
The bridegroom's previous marriage ended in divorce.
